Placemark.name: The Man
Placemark.description:
description: TEMPLE OF THE GOLDEN SPIKE (Man Base)

Our art theme in 2017 is RADICAL RITUAL. This leads to an obvious question: Just what is so radical about ritual? The word radical occurs three times in the Ten Principles, and most people regard this as referring to a breaking of boundaries and a shedding of restrictions. But radical has a second meaning: It refers to all that is fixed and fundamental in human nature.
Events: With a theme like Radical Ritual, it’s no wonder Burning Man 2017 will be home to 30 different Shrines.

At the center of Black Rock City, 20 Shrines will inscribe a circle around the Man base, known this year as the Temple of the Golden Spike. Throughout the week, the space will be energized with processions and rituals, inviting the denizens of BRC to explore what we as a community consider sacrosanct.
https://burningman.org/event/brc/2017-shrines-and-processionals/ 
Link: http://burningman.org

Data.name: description
Data.value:

But radical has a second meaning: It refers to all that is fixed and fundamental in human nature.

description: TEMPLE 2017
Events:
Link: http://www.temple2017.org/

Placemark.name: Wings of Eos
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine] 
Wings of Eos stands as a shrine in the Temple of the Golden Spike (Man Base). It measures 4x6' atop a 3' plinth, all composed of wood. Based on a Fibonacci spiral, the Wings are symmetrical and appear heart-shaped. Handprint "feathers" become individual pieces of art as they are inscribed and decorated by participants at events leading up to the burn. The Wings of Eos is named for Eos, the goddess of dawn and new beginnings, who, in Greek legend, opened the gates of heaven for her brother, the sun god Helios, to ride his chariot through each day, towing up the Sun. As a gift to Black Rock City, the Wings are hands-on art in its purest form and pay homage to the difference between a closed fist and an outstretched hand, which represents our opening to each other and how, as a community, we help each other rise. In this piece, the artist, Roxane "Bounce" Williams, conveys her gratitude for the many people whose outstretched hands helped her toward her new beginning.
Events: A Tuesday morning sunrise processional to the Wings of Eos shrine features women carrying and composing art from the negative space left behind during the laser cutting of the "feathers." Meditation and healing follow this ritual sunrise ceremony. 
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Man Pavilion Shrine] Wings of Eos stands as a shrine in the Temple of the Golden Spike (Man Base). It measures 4x6' atop a 3' plinth, all composed of wood. Based on a Fibonacci spiral, the Wings are symmetrical and appear heart-shaped. Handprint "feathers" become individual pieces of art as they are inscribed and decorated by participants at events leading up to the burn. The Wings of Eos is named for Eos, the goddess of dawn and new beginnings, who, in Greek legend, opened the gates of heaven for her brother, the sun god Helios, to ride his chariot through each day, towing up the Sun. As a gift to Black Rock City, the Wings are hands-on art in its purest form and pay homage to the difference between a closed fist and an outstretched hand, which represents our opening to each other and how, as a community, we help each other rise. In this piece, the artist, Roxane "Bounce" Williams, conveys her gratitude for the many people whose outstretched hands helped her toward her new beginning.

Placemark.name: Ahimsa Hamsa
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
Hands have power. The power to transform ideas into reality. The power to create, destroy, and alter the world around us. Ahimsa Hamsa is a shrine dedicated to peaceful and productive hands that encourages reflection and reverence to our most valuable tools. The hand in the sculpture takes the form of the Hamsa symbol, representing protection from the evil eye. It also closely resembles the Ahimsa symbol, representing non-violence. Made with repurposed wood from deconstructed missile crates, the sculpture transforms materials that once held weapons into art that encourages peace, inclusivity, and collaboration. A handmade ceramic relic will be placed within the hand following a ceremonial procession of high fives and handshakes during the week of Burning Man.
Events: Mon, Aug. 28 from 2-4pm: Ahimsa Hamsa Shrine Procession.
Come celebrate the awesomeness of hands in a hands-on procession and ceremony. Meet at Cafe Diem (4:15 and D) at 2pm or at the A.H. Shrine at the man pavilion at 3pm.
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Man Pavilion Shrine] Hands have power. The power to transform ideas into reality. The power to create, destroy, and alter the world around us. Ahimsa Hamsa is a shrine dedicated to peaceful and productive hands that encourages reflection and reverence to our most valuable tools. The hand in the sculpture takes the form of the Hamsa symbol, representing protection from the evil eye. It also closely resembles the Ahimsa symbol, representing non-violence. Made with repurposed wood from deconstructed missile crates, the sculpture transforms materials that once held weapons into art that encourages peace, inclusivity, and collaboration. A handmade ceramic relic will be placed within the hand following a ceremonial procession of high fives and handshakes during the week of Burning Man.

Placemark.name: Silent Lotus
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
The Silent Lotus is a shrine meant to create a therapeutic and healing space where participants can share a secret, intention, hope or regret with Harpocrates, Greek god of secrets. Written notes can be slipped into one of the four wooden pillars representing the bridges between roots and freedom. Harpocrates will guard the secrets until the last day, when they will burn along with the Man and bring relief and forgiveness.
Events:
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Man Pavilion Shrine] The Silent Lotus is a shrine meant to create a therapeutic and healing space where participants can share a secret, intention, hope or regret with Harpocrates, Greek god of secrets. Written notes can be slipped into one of the four wooden pillars representing the bridges between roots and freedom. Harpocrates will guard the secrets until the last day, when they will burn along with the Man and bring relief and forgiveness.

Placemark.name: Buddha Bank
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
Our piece looks like a laughing Buddha statue but it will have the head and arms of the man. It will have a clear belly so you can see the precious schwag building up in the bank.
Events:
Link:

Placemark.name: Northern Spork
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
The main feature of Northern Spork shrine will be a vertical spork; a symbol our regional group has adopted. The spork will be embossed with arcane symbols that have regional and historic meanings, that have been used in projects we have brought to playa over the last 4 years. Water plays an important role in our cultural identity, and as a cleansing medium. It will be a secondary feature as waves at the base of the spork. The offering receptacle, a jell-o mould, invites tributes and or messages from Burners who make a pilgrimage to the shrine. There will also be some personal references to pay tribute to MN Burners we have lost from this plane over the past few years.
Events:
Link:

Water plays an important role in our cultural identity, and as a cleansing medium. It will be a secondary feature as waves at the base of the spork. The offering receptacle, a jell-o mould, invites tributes and or messages from Burners who make a pilgrimage to the shrine. Placemark.name: Pagan Bunny Shrine
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
The Pagan Bunny (Golden Bunny) Shrine is a large golden shrine built for the symbolic relic of the Pagan Bunny. The Pagan Bunny is a symbol of the spirit of spring, the berth of fertility, ART and hoppiness. Everybunny is blessed with freshness, and are rejuvenated as they look upon the golden Pagan Bunny Shrine. Participants are encouraged to leave with the relic gifts to the SomeBunny Special, and to wish for fertility, love and rejuvenation.
Events: Monday 6:45pm - Processional
Link:

Everybunny is blessed with freshness, and are rejuvenated as they look upon the golden Pagan Bunny Shrine. Participants are encouraged to leave with the relic gifts to the SomeBunny Special, and to wish for fertility, love and rejuvenation.

Placemark.name: House of the Golden Raven
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
House of the Golden Raven is a spirit house, protecting Man Pavilion and the Black Rock City – all of its participants. The spirit of the Raven asks nothing more than is written on the four sides of its Shrine: “Know Thyself”, “Leave no Trace” and “Leave a better Place”. Or when offering, then: “Offer ideas, not MOOP”
Events:
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Man Pavilion Shrine] House of the Golden Raven is a spirit house, protecting Man Pavilion and the Black Rock City – all of its participants. The spirit of the Raven asks nothing more than is written on the four sides of its Shrine: “Know Thyself”, “Leave no Trace” and “Leave a better Place”. Or when offering, then: “Offer ideas, not MOOP”

Placemark.name: Abuelo Fuego
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
Abuelo Fuego is a shrine composed of a human effigy and a sacred mask Relic. The depicted being is a vessel of the torch of wisdom and wealth of knowledge through time. The top form emerges and rests as a crown on the head which is encircled with designs in relief. Wisdom and power is conjured through offering, ritual cleansing and dance. As a vessel, this shrine will burn with the Man and reveal a second Relic sub form.
Events:
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Man Pavilion Shrine] Abuelo Fuego is a shrine composed of a human effigy and a sacred mask Relic. The depicted being is a vessel of the torch of wisdom and wealth of knowledge through time. The top form emerges and rests as a crown on the head which is encircled with designs in relief. Wisdom and power is conjured through offering, ritual cleansing and dance. As a vessel, this shrine will burn with the Man and reveal a second Relic sub form.

Placemark.name: Morning Ritual
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
Morning Ritual is a dedication to the most unsung hero in our homes. Whether it’s the parent that needs a couple of minutes to themselves, a close embrace after a long night of drinking, the morning expulsion of fluids and matter, a young woman coming to learn of her transformation, or just a quick pee - the toilet is the ever present and sacrificial lamb to a clean and sanitary living.

The toilet stands 5 feet tall made of CNC plywood.

Morning Ritual will be placed near the 9 o'clock radial surrounding the Man. It is part of over 30 different art projects celebrating the sacred new age shrines of Burning Man 2017's theme: Radical Ritual. Larry Harvey himself hand picked our shrine, along with other members of the decision making team.
Events: Monday 6:45pm - Processional

We will be joining the Golden Bunny Shrine processional on Monday at 6:45pm to walk to the morning ritual shrine from our camp (Furry Gorilla Warfare at 5:15 and Ceremony). Carrying our plungers and handing out single ply toilet paper.

Friday at Dusk - Processional preparing for the burn

Link: https://www.facebook.com/MorningRitualBM17

Placemark.name: Guilded Brine Shrimp
Placemark.description:
description: [Man Pavilion Shrine]
The Gilded Brine Shrimp Shrine is a testament to the most radical ritual of all, that of the life of the Brine Shrimp every year on the flooded playa. The Brine Shrimp worshipers wish to take this opportunity to build a Golden Shrine to this amazing Artemia. With a large shrine in the shape of a half globe, representing the Brine Shrimp egg in cryptobiosis, the Brine Shrimp worshipers will present to the Gilded Brine Shrimp a large golden cloth to represent water. Sitting atop the half globe is a large Gilded Brine Shrimp, watching closely his offspring.
Events:
Link:

Data.value: [Man Pavilion Shrine] The Gilded Brine Shrimp Shrine is a testament to the most radical ritual of all, that of the life of the Brine Shrimp every year on the flooded playa. The Brine Shrimp worshipers wish to take this opportunity to build a Golden Shrine to this amazing Artemia. With a large shrine in the shape of a half globe, representing the Brine Shrimp egg in cryptobiosis, the Brine Shrimp worshipers will present to the Gilded Brine Shrimp a large golden cloth to represent water. Sitting atop the half globe is a large Gilded Brine Shrimp, watching closely his offspring.

Placemark.name: Aqueous
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
Aqueous in an interactive landscape of meandering pathways of light. During the day Aqueous will shift in color and reflection, mirroring the sky within a walkable dichroic surface. At night, Aqueous will flow and glow in full illuminated interactivity, engaging large groups in collaborative play.
Events:
Link: http://jenlewinstudio.com/aqueous

Placemark.name: Black Rock Blind Tiger
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
The Black Rock Blind Tiger is a rustic, vintage speakeasy and brothel deep within the playa, containing many oddities, gadgets and alluring objects. Participate, explore and immerse yourself to experience the magic of the Black Rock Blind Tiger. On the outside of these mysterious structures, there are gears at work—rumbling away, while producing delicate gifts. Enjoy the view from the widow’s walk, crowned with a charming cupola. Invent your own experience by touching, exploring and playing with all of the intriguing objects. Try gazing into the windows to see the playa past. Explore each of the objects, some will help keep you warm on those magical, chilly nights. Figure out the clues to determine the password which will allow you inside, but keep in mind—all the clues of yesterday will rapidly change to keep the Blind Tiger and its mysteries concealed. Once you’ve unlocked the pathway to the inside, enjoy the swanky speakeasy, dance to jazz, and receive your own personalized prescription.

Events:
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Location TBD] The Black Rock Blind Tiger is a rustic, vintage speakeasy and brothel deep within the playa, containing many oddities, gadgets and alluring objects. Participate, explore and immerse yourself to experience the magic of the Black Rock Blind Tiger. On the outside of these mysterious structures, there are gears at work—rumbling away, while producing delicate gifts. Enjoy the view from the widow’s walk, crowned with a charming cupola. Invent your own experience by touching, exploring and playing with all of the intriguing objects. Try gazing into the windows to see the playa past. Explore each of the objects, some will help keep you warm on those magical, chilly nights. Figure out the clues to determine the password which will allow you inside, but keep in mind—all the clues of yesterday will rapidly change to keep the Blind Tiger and its mysteries concealed. Once you’ve unlocked the pathway to the inside, enjoy the swanky speakeasy, dance to jazz, and receive your own personalized prescription.

Placemark.name: Black Rock Observatory
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
Welcome to the Black Rock Observatory. We are a mobile astronomical observatory dedicated to showing people just how amazing the universe is.

Events: This year we will be bringing a 20" aperture Dobsonian telescope to the playa! Together with the Desert Wizards, who brought you the Mars Rover last year, we'll have an observatory on the playa to house the 10' telescope, host star parties, events and more! You can expect to see planets, galaxies and nebulas if the conditions are right! 
Link: http://www.blackrockobservatory.com

Data.name: description

You can expect to see planets, galaxies and nebulas if the conditions are right!

Placemark.description:
description: Similar to Burma Shave signs, Burner Shave Signs will seek to entertain and humor you. The signs should be read from left to right as you walk or run along the trash fence.
Events: All week

Data.name: description

Placemark.name: Charon
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
A gigantic 30′ spinning wheel with posed human skeletons mounted on its inner edge, Peter Hudson's CHARON is fully powered by a minimum of 12 people working in unison. Participants are invited to pull a series of 6 ropes which cause the wheel to rotate progressively faster. When the rope pullers are coordinated enough to get the wheel spinning at the correct speed, a strobe is activated, revealing the skeletons’ animation. The animation tells the story of Charon, the mythological gondolier and ferryman of Hades who carried the souls of the recently departed across the river Styx, the last right of passage on the way to the afterlife.

Events:
Link: https://www.hudzo.com/charon/

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Location TBD] A gigantic 30′ spinning wheel with posed human skeletons mounted on its inner edge, Peter Hudson's CHARON is fully powered by a minimum of 12 people working in unison. Participants are invited to pull a series of 6 ropes which cause the wheel to rotate progressively faster. When the rope pullers are coordinated enough to get the wheel spinning at the correct speed, a strobe is activated, revealing the skeletons’ animation. The animation tells the story of Charon, the mythological gondolier and ferryman of Hades who carried the souls of the recently departed across the river Styx, the last right of passage on the way to the afterlife.

Placemark.name: Cosmic Space Worm
Placemark.description:
description: THE COSMIC SPACE WORM - a pedal-powered, segmented, aluminum worm built upon a train of adult tricycles. Able to hold up to five riders, the Space Worm will shine during the day with its metallic skin, and will shine at night with hundreds of color changing LEDs from within. It will be a sight to see!
Events:
Link: http://www.tylerfuquacreations.com/the-cosmic-space-worm.html

Able to hold up to five riders, the Space Worm will shine during the day with its metallic skin, and will shine at night with hundreds of color changing LEDs from within. It will be a sight to see!

Placemark.name: Coyote Garden
Placemark.description:
description: Coyote Garden is an interactive UV art installation created by over 30 artists and designers from around the world. Each coyote in the garden is a separate canvas that was presented to a different artist with complete artistic freedom. Coyote Garden was also created in part to help increase "coyote consciousness" and break down the 200+ year misinformation campaign that has vilified coyotes and made them the most persecuted animal in America history.

Events:
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: Coyote Garden is an interactive UV art installation created by over 30 artists and designers from around the world. Each coyote in the garden is a separate canvas that was presented to a different artist with complete artistic freedom. Coyote Garden was also created in part to help increase "coyote consciousness" and break down the 200+ year misinformation campaign that has vilified coyotes and made them the most persecuted animal in America history.

Placemark.name: Crystal Cat Thedral
Placemark.description:
description: A cathedral made of vines.
The unusually high water levels reclaiming Ancient Lake Lahontan this year have resulted in a rare occurrence. Turquoise vines bearing quartz crystals are sprouting upwards from the once dry desert floor. Alien cat-like forms are emerging from this primordial soup. These fantastic felines appear to be praying for (or perhaps preying on) their flat-faced human participants…
Events: Twice daily mass 
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: A cathedral made of vines. The unusually high water levels reclaiming Ancient Lake Lahontan this year have resulted in a rare occurrence. Turquoise vines bearing quartz crystals are sprouting upwards from the once dry desert floor. Alien cat-like forms are emerging from this primordial soup. These fantastic felines appear to be praying for (or perhaps preying on) their flat-faced human participants…

Placemark.name: Dance for the Dawn
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
Created by Lithuanian Burners, Dance for the Dawn is a ritual of dancing hands that symbolize our unity and living in synchronous harmony. It is our sight of the world around us.

The moving parts and integrated lights of the installation create endless loop and calls all burners for a relaxed ritual of the dawn. Small mirrors inside the hands play additionally with lights and reflections. Shadows of hands create a feeling of oracle magic.

Events:
Link: https://www.facebook.com/DanceForTheDawn

Data.value:
[Location TBD] Created by Lithuanian Burners, Dance for the Dawn is a ritual of dancing hands that symbolize our unity and living in synchronous harmony. It is our sight of the world around us.
The moving parts and integrated lights of the installation create endless loop and calls all burners for a relaxed ritual of the dawn. Small mirrors inside the hands play additionally with lights and reflections. Shadows of hands create a feeling of oracle magic.

Link: http://www.darumaproject.org/

Placemark.name: #DidNotFinish
Placemark.description:
description: #DidNotFinish - A skeleton by the trash fence wearing Burning Man 50k ultramarathon shirt and runner bib, with a "50k Ultramarathon Official Notice" sign listing hashtags why perhaps this person running the Burning Man Ultramarathon was not such a good idea.

Each year, over 200 burners start the Burning Man 50k (31 mile) ultramarathon running race. But not everyone finishes...

Here's a runner that perhaps had the best of intentions but, alas, it didn't work out so well for this burner. Maybe more training, maybe more water, but radical self reliance failed and now, like the failed climbers on Mt Everest, this runner humorously stands watch for all who now try.
Events:
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value:

Here's a runner that perhaps had the best of intentions but, alas, it didn't work out so well for this burner. Maybe more training, maybe more water, but radical self reliance failed and now, like the failed climbers on Mt Everest, this runner humorously stands watch for all who now try.

Placemark.name: Gummy Bear Pyramid
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
This is a 12ft tall, 4-sided pyramid made out of over 100,000 hand-cast gummy bears, acrylic, and metal.

This gummy bear pyramid began as an idea for a light installation using found objects. In time it has transformed into a kind of time machine. A place that invites you back into an illuminated fort of nostalgia.
Events:
Link: https://www.dicapria.com/pyramid

Data.value:

This gummy bear pyramid began as an idea for a light installation using found objects. In time it has transformed into a kind of time machine. A place that invites you back into an illuminated fort of nostalgia.

Placemark.name: House of Enlightenment
Placemark.description:
description: Because, as we all know, stepping outside the bounds of proscribed ritual are where we get into trouble with established authorities.
Events:
Link: https://douglasruuska.com/tower-of-light
https://www.fb.com/HouseOfEnlightenment2017
https://www.instagram.com/houseofenlightenment2017

Data.value: Because, as we all know, stepping outside the bounds of proscribed ritual are where we get into trouble with established authorities.

Placemark.name: La Victrola
Placemark.description:
description: La Victrola is a 30-foot tall wood and steel sculpture celebrating the music of a bygone era. Built by a community of volunteer artists at American Steel Studios in Oakland California, its period details, musical curation, and live performances stand as organic counterpoints to modern digital culture. La Victrola entertains and educates the public by playing crackly forgotten recordings from the early 1900s, a time of great innovation in jazz, blues, bluegrass, and country and western. On select evenings, La Victrola’s cabaret stage hosts period appropriate vaudeville and music performances transporting participants back in time.
Events:
Link: https://lavictrola.org/



https://www.youtube.com/embed/ak4xYJM8wRk

Data.name: description
Data.value: La Victrola is a 30-foot tall wood and steel sculpture celebrating the music of a bygone era. Built by a community of volunteer artists at American Steel Studios in Oakland California, its period details, musical curation, and live performances stand as organic counterpoints to modern digital culture. La Victrola entertains and educates the public by playing crackly forgotten recordings from the early 1900s, a time of great innovation in jazz, blues, bluegrass, and country and western. On select evenings, La Victrola’s cabaret stage hosts period appropriate vaudeville and music performances transporting participants back in time.

Placemark.name: Lost Cargo
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
Lost Cargo exists frozen in time, an aircraft moments from crashing. In this moment, who are we? Where are we going? What have we accomplished? Are we afraid?
Events:
Link: https://www.facebook.com/aLostCargo

Placemark.name: #L❤veChain
Placemark.description:
description: #LOVECHAIN- A 24 Hour Ritual of Radical Hugs at Burning Man 2017
Events: For 24 Hours, Tex and Cat will be stationary on the Playa (next to The Pier), awake from sunrise Wednesday 'til sunrise Thursday, giving out FREE HUGS!
We'll also be bound to the Playa to give out love via 20 feet of chain, attached to 2 feet of rebar, sunk into the desert floor...
Everyone we hug will get a white paper wristband, which they'll be encouraged to write a wish on, then secure it to the other wishes to make a paper chain. That chain will be placed at the Temple, around the altar base by a Global Women's Circle Gathering ceremony on Saturday morning.
Link: https://www.facebook.com/events/1336552133047287

Data.name: description
Data.value: #LOVECHAIN- A 24 Hour Ritual of Radical Hugs at Burning Man 2017

We'll also be bound to the Playa to give out love via 20 feet of chain, attached to 2 feet of rebar, sunk into the desert floor... Everyone we hug will get a white paper wristband, which they'll be encouraged to write a wish on, then secure it to the other wishes to make a paper chain. That chain will be placed at the Temple, around the altar base by a Global Women's Circle Gathering ceremony on Saturday morning.

Placemark.name: Magic Paint Mirror
Placemark.description:
description: A night time only interactive video piece that allows you to paint pictures with the movement of your hands. Ball two fists in the air in fron of the installation for a brush pallet and color selection. Screen captures from every 10 seconds will be made into a movie at the end of the event.

Placemark.name: Margareta Appalachia
Placemark.description:
description: Phase I: Colossal woman striding across the playa in an interpretation of classical Korean Hanbok robes. Her body, hair and clothing are made out of natural burnable materials, including coal. There is a small 'mine shaft' door in her dress that takes people to a coal-seam inspired room presenting a panorama of a Carboniferous rainforest.
Events: At dusk and dawn a 20 minute film "Margaret" (1990) by John McCormick will be projected featuring stories from the life of a Korean-American kid thriving in Appalachia
Link: https://sites.google.com/site/margaretaappalachia/

Data.name: description

Her body, hair and clothing are made out of natural burnable materials, including coal. There is a small 'mine shaft' door in her dress that takes people to a coal-seam inspired room presenting a panorama of a Carboniferous rainforest.

Data.name: Events

Placemark.name: Meownge
Placemark.description:
description: As you approach the Meownge, prepare to be hypnotized by an interactive 14 foot tall cat head structure. Your curiosity will surely kick in and you won’t be able to help yourself. Crafted out of conduit and 4 way stretch lycra the Meownge will provide you and your feline friends with enough shade and space to nap the day away. With amplified purrs resonating from it's ears, you'll find yourself in a blissfull zone of total relaxation. Purrrrfect to help you prepare for the true party animal you are. Which of course, comes out at night. As the sun falls into the horizon and the stars begin to twinkle, the Meownge transforms into an interactive light piece that invites you to play! It's spot light eyes will track and lure you in, challenging you to take control. Lined with over 600 feet of LEDs you will decide what happens next. Your movements will direct how each LED will react. Imagine, an orchestra of lights coming to life with your very own feline prowess! The best part? All cats are welcome! Come to the Meownge to groom your soul and explore the kitty you always knew you were.
Events:
Link: https://www.meownge.com

Data.name: description
Data.value: As you approach the Meownge, prepare to be hypnotized by an interactive 14 foot tall cat head structure. Your curiosity will surely kick in and you won’t be able to help yourself. Crafted out of conduit and 4 way stretch lycra the Meownge will provide you and your feline friends with enough shade and space to nap the day away. With amplified purrs resonating from it's ears, you'll find yourself in a blissfull zone of total relaxation. Purrrrfect to help you prepare for the true party animal you are. Which of course, comes out at night. As the sun falls into the horizon and the stars begin to twinkle, the Meownge transforms into an interactive light piece that invites you to play! It's spot light eyes will track and lure you in, challenging you to take control. Lined with over 600 feet of LEDs you will decide what happens next. Your movements will direct how each LED will react. Imagine, an orchestra of lights coming to life with your very own feline prowess! The best part? All cats are welcome! Come to the Meownge to groom your soul and explore the kitty you always knew you were.

Placemark.name: Methuselah
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
Methuselah is a 20′ metal sculpture of the world’s oldest tree. The tree’s bark is steel, patinated to blue, brown and white, and seams of glass reveal propane flames within the trunk, reflected in a mirror below. The tree’s roots form benches on which Burners can congregate.

Ancestry and evolution are central themes for our work, whose namesake’s rings and branches bore witness to the entire span of recorded human history. Great trees gave their limbs and leaves as axles, paper, bows, hulls and roofs, and held space and time for our ancestors’ radical rituals.

Black Rock City contains many altars of dance and ecstasy, and many more of learning and relaxation, but the city provides comparatively few spaces for contemplation and remembrance.

Circular spaces, lone trees and eternal flames are all strong ritualistic symbols and joining them in Methuselah helps to dislocate Participants from the frenzy of present day time and re-anchors them in the still time of mythology.
Events:
Link: http://graydavidson.com/methuselah
https://www.facebook.com/majorellearts

Data.name: description
Data.value:
[Location TBD] Methuselah is a 20′ metal sculpture of the world’s oldest tree. The tree’s bark is steel, patinated to blue, brown and white, and seams of glass reveal propane flames within the trunk, reflected in a mirror below. The tree’s roots form benches on which Burners can congregate.
Ancestry and evolution are central themes for our work, whose namesake’s rings and branches bore witness to the entire span of recorded human history. Great trees gave their limbs and leaves as axles, paper, bows, hulls and roofs, and held space and time for our ancestors’ radical rituals.
Black Rock City contains many altars of dance and ecstasy, and many more of learning and relaxation, but the city provides comparatively few spaces for contemplation and remembrance.
Circular spaces, lone trees and eternal flames are all strong ritualistic symbols and joining them in Methuselah helps to dislocate Participants from the frenzy of present day time and re-anchors them in the still time of mythology.

Placemark.name: MÚCARO
Placemark.description:
description: MÚCARO is a 32' wise and woody owl with a head that rotates 360!

Participants enter and exit through an opening under one of the wings. Inside the body is a cozy space with high ceilings and a spiral staircase that journeys through childhood memories. The walls are set-designed to take you back in time and travel through school years as you climb. At the height of the stairs are two built-in ladders for easy access to and from the top. It is here where you find the focal point — a sweeping view of the playa through MÚCARO’s giant eyes that move with the head as it rotates!

MÚCARO soars to Black Rock City as a testament to the wisdom of all our teachers, the people who (hoo!) inspired us. El NiNO is dedicating MÚCARO to one teacher in particular in Puerto Rico: his mom, Mrs. Hilda Alicea, who taught in Puerto Rico for more than 45 years inspiring young people to go for their dreams.
Events:
Link: https://www.facebook.com/mucaroartinstallation

Data.name: description
Data.value:
MÚCARO is a 32' wise and woody owl with a head that rotates 360!
Participants enter and exit through an opening under one of the wings. Inside the body is a cozy space with high ceilings and a spiral staircase that journeys through childhood memories. The walls are set-designed to take you back in time and travel through school years as you climb. At the height of the stairs are two built-in ladders for easy access to and from the top. It is here where you find the focal point — a sweeping view of the playa through MÚCARO’s giant eyes that move with the head as it rotates!
MÚCARO soars to Black Rock City as a testament to the wisdom of all our teachers, the people who (hoo!) inspired us. El NiNO is dedicating MÚCARO to one teacher in particular in Puerto Rico: his mom, Mrs. Hilda Alicea, who taught in Puerto Rico for more than 45 years inspiring young people to go for their dreams.

Placemark.name: Pleiadian Oasis
Placemark.description:
description: The Pleiadian Oasis is a safe space for people in all phases of consciousness out in the deep playa. A constellation of sacred geometric structures is mapped out to mirror the stars of the Pleiades. This hazy cluster by the trash fence serves as a beacon calling all light workers, cosmic healers, mystical visionaries, desert philosophers and deep playa interdimensional travellers.
Events: night
Link:

Placemark.name: Pyramid of the Dead
Placemark.description:
description: [Location approximate]
The Pyramid of the Dead is a structure comprised of individual “nichos”, artisanal hand made tin altars. The artworks displayed in the nichos are designed by different people from the Burner community, and offer respectful and personal tributes to deceased loved ones. The nichos are exhibited together, in the form of a pyramid and community altar. This is a deeply profound piece inspired by the day of the dead and the Mesoamerican architecture put in a completely new contemporary context while maintaining its deep meaning.

Events: On the evening of Thursday August 31st, we will adorn ourselves in the traditional ‘Catrina’ facepaint of Dia de Muertos, and at 9pm we will gather at THE TEMPLE (12:00) for a procession to THE PYRAMID OF THE DEAD at Xantolo (1:30/Outer Playa).

At the Pyramid of the Dead, a ceremony to honor and express respect for the dead, and three brief reflections on Life & Death -- DEADtalks -- will be followed by a ecstatic spiritual dance party curated by renowned Mexican Art Cars Mayan Warrior and !Axolotl! The Earth Guardian -- until 1am.

Together we will DANCE with our beloved DEAD -- and CELEBRATE their presence as inspiration for our LIVES. Honor the Dead - Celebrate Life.

And please continue to support our Pyramid! 
Link: https://www.facebook.com/pyramidofthedead

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Location approximate] The Pyramid of the Dead is a structure comprised of individual “nichos”, artisanal hand made tin altars. The artworks displayed in the nichos are designed by different people from the Burner community, and offer respectful and personal tributes to deceased loved ones. The nichos are exhibited together, in the form of a pyramid and community altar. This is a deeply profound piece inspired by the day of the dead and the Mesoamerican architecture put in a completely new contemporary context while maintaining its deep meaning.

Data.name: Events
Data.value:
On the evening of Thursday August 31st, we will adorn ourselves in the traditional ‘Catrina’ facepaint of Dia de Muertos, and at 9pm we will gather at THE TEMPLE (12:00) for a procession to THE PYRAMID OF THE DEAD at Xantolo (1:30/Outer Playa).
At the Pyramid of the Dead, a ceremony to honor and express respect for the dead, and three brief reflections on Life & Death -- DEADtalks -- will be followed by a ecstatic spiritual dance party curated by renowned Mexican Art Cars Mayan Warrior and !Axolotl! The Earth Guardian -- until 1am.
Together we will DANCE with our beloved DEAD -- and CELEBRATE their presence as inspiration for our LIVES. Honor the Dead - Celebrate Life.
And please continue to support our Pyramid!

Placemark.name: Shibari Sanctuary
Placemark.description:
description: Location TBD
Shibari Sanctuary is a 20 foot tall mountain made up of 11 miles of rope hand tied in a geometric web pattern using Kinbaku, or Japanese rope bondage. As you enter the mountain, you'll find a womb-like interior where you can get tied, or relax and enjoy performances by some of the best riggers in the world. The project is an exploration of natural highs celebrating that magical tingly feeling that spreads from the back of your neck down the spine to every corner of your body. This project is lead by Benjamin Langholz and his teacher Kinoko Hajime from Japan. Our crew is made up of members from Tokyo, including a 4 person traditional Japanese band as well as a collection of some of the best riggers from around the world.
Events: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, performance 6:00pm Friday 8:00pm burn
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: Location TBD Shibari Sanctuary is a 20 foot tall mountain made up of 11 miles of rope hand tied in a geometric web pattern using Kinbaku, or Japanese rope bondage. As you enter the mountain, you'll find a womb-like interior where you can get tied, or relax and enjoy performances by some of the best riggers in the world. The project is an exploration of natural highs celebrating that magical tingly feeling that spreads from the back of your neck down the spine to every corner of your body. This project is lead by Benjamin Langholz and his teacher Kinoko Hajime from Japan. Our crew is made up of members from Tokyo, including a 4 person traditional Japanese band as well as a collection of some of the best riggers from around the world.

Placemark.name: Shogyo Mujo
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
Shogyo Mujo is a unique installation that utilizes projections, lighting, and music to bring a sculpture to life. BARTKRESA studio and sculptor Josh Harker collaborated on the twelve-foot tall faceted skull, exploring the intersection of the physical and the imagination. Shogyo Mujo represents the first of the three marks of Dharma, which states that all things are impermanent. The project has evolved into a 360° musically driven, interactive visual centerpiece that has been featured at festivals and creative events.
Events:
Link: http://shogyomujo.org

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Location TBD] Shogyo Mujo is a unique installation that utilizes projections, lighting, and music to bring a sculpture to life. BARTKRESA studio and sculptor Josh Harker collaborated on the twelve-foot tall faceted skull, exploring the intersection of the physical and the imagination. Shogyo Mujo represents the first of the three marks of Dharma, which states that all things are impermanent. The project has evolved into a 360° musically driven, interactive visual centerpiece that has been featured at festivals and creative events.

Placemark.name: Solaris
Placemark.description:
description: Solaris stands as a large, colorfully painted canvas bold in contrast to the mystical sand colors of the deep playa. As the abstract canvas breathes among the wind in solidarity, from afar one catches a glimpse from its colorful accents during the day and when lit and alive night. Its true golden hour exists during the celebration of the sun as it faces and frames the magical moment of sunrise.
Events:
Link:

Data.name: description
Data.value: Solaris stands as a large, colorfully painted canvas bold in contrast to the mystical sand colors of the deep playa. As the abstract canvas breathes among the wind in solidarity, from afar one catches a glimpse from its colorful accents during the day and when lit and alive night. Its true golden hour exists during the celebration of the sun as it faces and frames the magical moment of sunrise.

Placemark.name: Solipmission
Placemark.description:
description: A small crew of artists will be locked up inside a black box for the entire week of the event. They will create a virtual Burning Man on the inside walls without ever viewing the outside, just based on what visitors tell them.
Events:
Link: https://www.solipmission.com/



https://www.youtube.com/embed/jKnsXD_tpDo

Data.name: description
Data.value: A small crew of artists will be locked up inside a black box for the entire week of the event. They will create a virtual Burning Man on the inside walls without ever viewing the outside, just based on what visitors tell them.

Placemark.name: Temple of Awareness
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
(built by the Utah Builders Community)
Temples offer environments for us to immerse ourselves into an unworldly place of harmony and peace. The Temple of Awareness is an organic form, similar to a pine cone. Seen from above, it evokes aspects of a bloomed lotus. The Temple is a 13-sided dome structure that is 35 ft. in diameter at the base. It has seven levels that reach 35 ft. high, each level with projecting decorative wings encircling it.
Events:
Link:



https://www.youtube.com/embed/-Ys926FnWik

The Temple is a 13-sided dome structure that is 35 ft. in diameter at the base. It has seven levels that reach 35 ft. high, each level with projecting decorative wings encircling it.

Placemark.name: Temple of Gravity
Placemark.description:
description: Gravity is a central component of all of Zachary Coffin’s massive, larger-than-life interactive kinetic sculptures and the only force that he believes he can truly have faith in. 
The Temple of Gravity is a 60-foot diameter steel dome with 5 arms, each arm supports a suspended granite stone slab (which weighs ~15,000 pounds) and is anchored by a granite base slab.
Events:
Link:

Placemark.name: The Journey
Placemark.description:
description: The Journey is an interactive, wood sculpture inspired by the double-helix and is reflective on our journey through life. Utilizing music, lighting, and responsive technology, The Journey inspires to reflect and create experiences for self and community within its walkable structure.
Events:
Link: http://thejourneyproject.org

Placemark.name: The Pier
Placemark.description:
description: THE PIER captures a sense of imagination and wonder. A forgotten nostalgia in those who walk down it, fish off the end of it and hop on a boat for a leisurely journey around the remnants of Lake Lahontan. It is ragged and rough, well loved and cared for. Like a distant childhood dream slipping back out of the void to gift a smile and then fade away. 
Events:
Link:

Placemark.name: The Tower of Not Babel
Placemark.description:
description: A climbable Tower that has traveled to numerous Regional Burns in the Northeast, each event being limited to one side. A traveling Time Capsule of Burner expression from Playa del Fuego - DE (twice), Wickerman - PA, POrtalBurn -
NY (twice), NECTR - CT, Scorched Nuts - OH, Firefly - VT, and the Rochester NY Mini Maker Faire.
Events: It burns Friday night at 9:00!
Link: http://www.towerofnotbabel.org/

Placemark.name: Tonglen
Placemark.description:
description: [Location TBD]
The Buddhist practice of receiving and accepting bad energy and sending out and letting go of one's good energy is embodied in this prayer engine made of steel and fire. Kinetic human input - this breathing in and out, air and fire - is a visible, accessible amplification of Tonglen.

Events:
Link: http://www.prayer-engine.com

Data.name: description
Data.value: [Location TBD] The Buddhist practice of receiving and accepting bad energy and sending out and letting go of one's good energy is embodied in this prayer engine made of steel and fire. Kinetic human input - this breathing in and out, air and fire - is a visible, accessible amplification of Tonglen.
